alert.note: Alert for Magoffin; McCreary; Owsley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 06 at 6:24PM EDT until May 06 at 8:15PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of south central Kentucky and southeast Kentucky, including the following counties, in south central Kentucky, Laurel, McCreary and Whitley. In southeast Kentucky, Bell, Breathitt, Clay, Floyd, Knott, Knox, Leslie, Magoffin, Owsley and Perry. * WHEN...Until 845 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 622 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. Locally higher amounts are possible. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... London, Williamsburg, Hazard, Barbourville, Jackson, Manchester, Hindman, Hyden, Whitley City, Estill, Martin, Pippa Passes, Wayland, Vicco, Buckhorn, Hector, Botto, Boho, Goose Rock and Plank. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
